definitions.definition: a public celebration of a special day or event, usually with bands in the streets and decorated vehicles

examples.text: St Patrick’s Day parade in New York
The parade is held every year.
Thousands of people were at the parade.

definitions.definition: a formal occasion when soldiers march or stand in lines so that they can be inspected (= looked at and approved) by their officers or other important people

examples.text: They held a parade to mark the soldiers' return.
They stood as straight as soldiers on parade.
The latest software will be on parade at the exhibition.

definitions.definition: a series of things or people

examples.text: Each generation passes through a similar parade of events.

definitions.definition: a street with a row of small shops
an obvious display of something, particularly in order to impress other people

examples.text: Social media is a constant parade of wealth, happiness, success and vanity.

definitions.definition: to prevent somebody from enjoying an event; to cause somebody's plans to fail

wordOrigin: mid 17th cent.: from French, literally ‘a showing’, from Spanish parada and Italian parata, based on Latin parare ‘prepare, furnish’.
